reviews.review_msg: i skipped the first three weeks of class thinking it's some bs class, and boy i was wrong.. at first i didn't give a single damn to seriously learn anything from a "literature class" and only took it to boost my gpa. ted brings so much emotion and passion on his lectures. def made me reflect the deeper purpose of life from his selection of books.
He is an amazing professor who helped me through a lot. His lectures were amazing and honestly I'm glad i took his course.

Avoid it if you can. Terrible and very difficult assignments (essays). I don't understand how we suppose to write an essay to get more than a B. I wish I had not taken this course. Also, midterm is called a quiz just to save the class and after a very boring 1.5 hours, you will have to answer a million questions.
One of the worst courses I have taken. Too difficult to be elective, needs much more effort than required courses. Do not recommend

Ted is probably one of the best professors I've ever met. Great teaching that gets you so engaged with the course material during and even outside of class. I used to hate literature but now I really learnt to appreciate good plays and the emotions and messages behind them.

He's amazing and passionate, he truly cares about his students and makes it a really easy-going class. You will like theatre plays you'd never imagine you would like. 
He's pretty open and supportive. 

Would definetly take him again if I had the chance.

He is one of the nicest profs you can have!!!!!!!!!! You will be able to relate to the books he teaches and he explains everything in the most amazing way. He is always looking out for his students and will help you as much as you need.
